citation.article-title: Acetobacterium tundrae sp. nov., a new psychrophilic acetogenic bacterium from tundra soil.

p.s: Description of Acetobacterium tundrae sp. nov.
Acetobacterium tundrae (tun'drae. M.L. fem. n., tundrae from the tundra (a cold treeless zone located in the north of Eurasia and North America)
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Maltose, mannose, fructose, glucose, xylose, pyruvate, lactate, methanol and methyl groups of betaine utilized for growth and fermented to acetate.
Autotrophic growth on H2/CO2, CO and formate; acetate formed.
Psychrophilic, optimal temperature for growth is 20 °C, maximum 30°C, minimum 1 °C.
pH range for growth is 6.0–8.0, optimum 7.0.
The main components of the lipid complex of the cells are the saturated aldehyde C16:0 and the unsaturated fatty acid C16:1∆9.
Isolated from tundra wetland soil of Polar Ural, 68 N, 65E.
